newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PHILIPPINE STOCKS - factors to watch - Nov 6.
newsitem.headline: PHILIPPINE STOCKS - factors to watch - Nov 6.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Philippine stocks on Wednesday:
* On Tuesday, the Dow Jones rose 39.50 points to 6,081.18. PLDT's ADR dropped by $0 1/2 to $59 1/8.
* The peso closed on Monday at 26.255 to a U.S. dollar from 26.281
* The Philippine Stock Exchange index closed at 2,987.18, up 11.04.
* The Philippine interbank call loan rate was up at 12.28125 from 11.625 pct
* The National Statistics Office said Philippine October inflation was at 4.7 pct vs September level of 4.4 pct

* The BusinessWorld says business groups were mildly surprosed by the lower-than-expected October inflation rate. The paper said the Philippine Chamber of Commerce and Industry (PCCI) and the Federation of Philippine Industires said the 4.7 percent rate only proved there is no reason for a mandated wage hike.

* The Business Daily quoting Central Bank Treasury Director Sergio Edeza said that overnight lending rates were raised on Tuesday from 13 percent to 15 percent to quell speculative attacks against the peso.
* Petron and the National Power Corp signed a 16 billion peso fuel supply contract with Petron providing the power firm 2.2 billion liters of fuel oil and diesel in the next two years.
To contribute to this page, please fax your comments on the stock market to Reuters newsroom on fax (632) 817 6267. For details, please phone the newsroom on (632) 841 8934.
